name: UIEvent
description: The UIEvent interface represents simple user interface events.

parameters.name: typeArg
parameters.description: Is a DOMString representing the name of the event.

members.name: UIEvent.cancelBubble
members.description: Is a Boolean indicating whether the bubbling of the event has been canceled or not.

members.name: UIEvent.detail
members.description: Returns a long with details about the event, depending on the event type.

members.name: UIEvent.isChar
members.description: Returns a Boolean indicating whether the event produced a key character or not.

members.name: UIEvent.layerX
members.description: Returns the horizontal coordinate of the event relative to the current layer.

members.name: UIEvent.layerY
members.description: Returns the vertical coordinate of the event relative to the current layer.

members.name: UIEvent.pageX
members.description: Returns the horizontal coordinate of the event relative to the whole document.

members.name: UIEvent.pageY
members.description: Returns the vertical coordinate of the event relative to the whole document.

members.name: UIEvent.sourceCapabilities
members.description: Returns an instance of the InputDeviceCapabilities interface which provides information about the physical device responsible for generating a touch event.

members.name: UIEvent.view
members.description: Returns a WindowProxy that contains the view that generated the event.

members.name: UIEvent.which
members.description: Returns the numeric keyCode of the key pressed, or the character code (charCode) for an alphanumeric key pressed.

members.name: UIEvent.initUIEvent()
members.description: Initializes a UIEvent object. If the event has already being dispatched, this method does nothing.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Is a DOMString defining the type of event.

parameters.name: canBubble
parameters.description: Is a Boolean deciding whether the event should bubble up through the event chain or not. Once set, the read-only property Event.bubbles will give its value.

parameters.name: cancelable
parameters.description: Is a Boolean defining whether the event can be canceled. Once set, the read-only property Event.cancelable will give its value.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Is the WindowProxy associated with the event.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: Is an unsigned long  specifying some detail information about the event, depending on the type of event. For mouse events, it indicates how many times the mouse has been clicked on a given screen location.
